sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find the values of (A × B) ∩ B and A × (B ∩ A). Then, show that the Cartesian product of sets A, B, and C is not associative with respect to intersection, i.e., (A × B) × C ≠ A × (B × C).
